Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Sandals
Description: Sandals were known in Pharaonic Egypt, and the most well known examples are the funerary sandals found in the tomb of Tutankhamun. These sandals are made of strips of wood. They are in the shape of the foot with raised edges. It is to be noted, also, that the big toe is usually identified.
